option: Whether to convert a deduced large induction-variable step that represents a small negative step, to that small negative step. For example, in some cases an 8-bit step of -1 is represented in the code or intermediate analysis results by a positive step of 255, relying on wrap-around of two's complement addition. This option lets the analysis assume that adding 255 to an 8-bit induction variable is the same as subtracting 1 from the variable, as far as the resulting value of the variable is concerned.
